While many in our government never expected Mexico to live up to the terms of the treaties anyhow, they do suggest that this might be enough cause for the Americans to intervene. Such an intervention would, of course, be inviting the wolves through the front door… but do we have any other choice?
War With Mexico!

A diplomat has arrived in Washington from Texas-a part of the Mexican frontier, settled by southerners who had been offered land by the Mexican government and who then rebelled against its tyranny. The diplomat has asked for American intervention in their war, claiming that a treaty had been worked out with Mexico which they then of course immediately refuted. It seems like shaky grounds… but do we turn our backs on them?
The Texan Diplomat
Tell them we will do what we can.
They are on their own.

The Battle of the Alamo was a pivotal event in the Texas Revolution. Following a 13-day siege, Mexican troops under President General Antonio López de Santa Anna reclaimed the Alamo Mission near San Antonio de Béxar, killing the Texian and immigrant occupiers. Santa Anna's cruelty during the battle inspired many Texians, both legal Texas settlers and illegal immigrants from the United States, to join the Texian Army.
The Battle of the Alamo
Hey Santa Anna, we're killing your soldiers below!

In the wake of our successes against Mexico, a society has formed around a core of Eastern Democrats who propose to extend our claims and annex significant portions, if not indeed the entirety of Mexico. While this would leave us undoubtedly the foremost power of the continent, there are concerns among many in the Senate as to the specifics of these potential annexations. The debate boils down to two issues: the issue of slavery, and the issue of citizenship.
The discussion of slavery brings into question the viability of keeping a balance between free states and slave states with the significant number of Mexican states that would be annexed, seeing as Mexico has abolished slavery in 1829, and the institution would likely not take root there.
The discussion of citizenship focused on the consequences of extending American citizenship and voting rights to millions of Mexicans, who would likely greatly affect the voting base and cause an imbalance on the federal level. Many in the Senate who idealistically interpret the idea of Manifest Destiny maintain that the laws of the United States should not be imposed on people against their will and point out cultural issues of including millions of Hispanic Catholic Mexicans in the south, as opposed to the sparsely populated territories we originally claimed.

 §RNOTE: You will be able to return to this menu from the second and third option.§!
The 'All of Mexico' Movement
We shall incorporate no new states
Let us drive the border south, but not take the major population centres
By Jingo, all of Mexico shall be ours!
We will decide later

The extended Mexican Cession proposed to the Senate would include the Mexican states of Lower California, Sonora, Sinaloa, Chihuahua, Coahuila, Tamaulipas and New Leon. While not as populated as the south of Mexico, they will prove harder to assimilate than New Mexico and Upper California. The discussion quickly turned to slavery and the potential compromises that both sides see as an inevitable outcome of integrating these territories. While the exact status of these states will be passed into law after the war, both camps desire assurances that their demands will be honoured.
The Status of Slavery in the New States
Favour the slave states
Favour the free states
Try to strike a balance
On second thought.. (go back)
The proposal for the extension of our claims to the northern Mexican states is ready to be passed into law. All that is left is to have faith in our troops in the field.
The Greater Mexico Cession
They will be welcomed into the union, whether they like it or not..

The annexation of Mexico proposed to the senate would be a milestone event in the history of the union, bringing about a large, Hispanic, Catholic, abolitionist population to the Union. Holding on to this territory and administering it will be a challenge, but one the American people are ready to face in the name of Manifest Destiny. The discussion quickly turned to slavery and the potential compromises that both sides see as an inevitable outcome of integrating these territories. While the exact status of these states will be passed into law after the war, both camps desire assurances that their demands will be honoured.
The Status of Slavery in Mexico
Favour the slave states
Favour the free states
Try to strike a balance
On second thought.. (go back)
The proposal for the annexation of Mexico is ready to be passed into law. All that is left is to have faith in our troops in the field.
The Annexation of Mexico
They will be welcomed into the union, whether they like it or not..
After a decade of general stability, the assassination of President Ulises Heureaux revealed that the many deals he made with foreign banks has left the country bankrupt.
FRENCH: Après dix ans de stabilité générale, l'assassinat du président Ulises Heureaux a révélé que les nombreux accords qu'il avait conclus avec les banques étrangères ont causé la ruine du pays.
GERMAN: Nach einem Jahrzehnt allgemeiner Stabilität wurde durch die Ermordung von Ulises Heureaux aufgedeckt, dass das Land durch die vielen Geheimverträge des Ermordeten mit ausländischen Banken in den Ruin gestürzt worden ist.

ENGLISH: President Heureaux Assassinated
FRENCH: Le président Heureaux a été assassiné
GERMAN: Präside nt Heureaux ermordet

ENGLISH: A tragedy!
FRENCH: Quelle tragédie !
GERMAN: Eine Tragödie!

ENGLISH: Relations with the Church were improved through the Concordat of 1860, which allows the return of French clergy and the establishment of parochial schools.
FRENCH: Le concordat de 1860 a amélioré les relations de l'État et de l'Église. Celui-ci autorisait le retour en France du clergé et l'établissement d'écoles paroissiales.
GERMAN: Die Beziehungen zur Kirchen haben sich durch das Konkordat von 1860 verbessert. Das Konkordat gestattet die Rückkehr des französischen Klerus und die Errichtung parochialer Schulen.

ENGLISH: Concordat with the Vatican
FRENCH: Concordat avec le Vatican
GERMAN: Konkordat mit dem Vatikan

ENGLISH: Harmony with the Church.
FRENCH: Harmonie avec l'Église.

ENGLISH: Faustan Soulique, the compromise candidate for President in 1847, declared himself the second emperor of Haiti as Faustin I.
FRENCH: Faustin Soulouque, candidat compromis à la présidentielle de 1847, s'est proclamé second empereur d'Haïti sous le nom de Faustin Ier.
GERMAN: Der 1847 zum Präsidenten gewählte General Faustin Soulouque hat sich selbst zum Kaiser Faustin I. von Haiti gekrönt.

ENGLISH: Soulique Declares Himself Emperor
FRENCH: Soulouque se proclame empereur
GERMAN: Soulique erklärt sich selbst zum Kaiser

ENGLISH: Vive l’Empereur Faustin!
FRENCH: Vive l'empereur Faustin !
GERMAN: Vive l'Empereur Faustin!

ENGLISH: Juan Pablo Duarte has founded a secret society called ‘La Trinitaria’, seeking complete independence of Santo Domingo from Haiti and other foreign powers. Many Caribenos are calling the man a visionary, and his ideas are gaining great popularity in eastern Hispaniola.
La Trinitaria
This will not do.
La Trinitaria Society was victorious and our independence is now complete. We remained independent long enough for the world to recognize us as a sovereign state!
The Dominican Independence
Viva la República Dominicana!

Rebels in the east of Haiti have seized the Ozama fortress and defeated the Haitian garrison in Santo Domingo. The rebels have declared the Dominican Republic’s sovereignty restored and with it an end to Haitian rule. All government officials have been expelled from Santo Domingo at what looks to be the beginning of a Civil War that will determine the fate of Hispaniola.
Dominican War of Independence!
Hispaniola must be united!
Onwards to Santo Domingo!

The $MONARCHTITLE$ called a plebiscite on a possible annexation by $FROMCOUNTRY$ as a path to secure our freedoms away from Haiti and to join the prosperous country. The majority has spoken and 99.7% of the Dominican Republic wants this fusion.\n \n At least that’s the official version, it’s widely known and accepted that the plebiscite was forged by the $MONARCHTITLE$ in an attempt to get rich off the more $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ jingoistic politicians by selling off the Dominican Republic. The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government seems to be in cahoots with him and intend to carry on with the facade as long as the plebiscite backs it up.
Plebiscite on Dominican Independence
Seems like everything is in order.
Denounce the plebiscite.
Haiti’s Debts to France

Haiti’s legacy of debt began shortly after gaining independence from France in 1804. In 1825, France, with warships at the ready, demanded Haiti compensate France for its loss of slaves and its slave colony. In exchange for French recognition of Haiti as a sovereign republic, France demanded payment of 150 million francs. In addition to the payment, France required that Haiti discount its exported goods to them by 50%. In $YEAR$, France agreed to reduce the debt to 90 million francs to be paid over a period of 30 years to compensate former plantation owners who had lost their property. This is the best deal we can get, and refusing to honour our debt will likely result in French intervention.
We must honour our agreements. §R(Pay or owe 500,000¤)§W
We owe nothing to the French.
Haiti Fails to Honour its Debts

Haiti’s legacy of debt began shortly after gaining independence from France in 1804. In 1825, France, with warships at the ready, demanded Haiti compensate France for its loss of slaves and its slave colony. In exchange for French recognition of Haiti as a sovereign republic, France demanded payment of 150 million francs. In addition to the payment, France required that Haiti discount its exported goods to them by 50%. In $YEAR$, France agreed to reduce the debt to 90 million francs (500,000¤) to be paid over a period of 30 years to compensate former plantation owners who had lost their property. Haiti, however, still refuses to pay what is owed to us and will not do so unless we use force.
We will take what is owed to us.
To safeguard French assets, the Haitian government must be controlled.
Clearly, the Haitians are not fit to rule themselves.
They are not worth our time.
$FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ Intervention in $COUNTRY$

After refusing to pay our debt to the $FROMCOUNTRY$, a bloody war ensued. Now, as the result of our latest defeat, the $FROMCOUNTRY$ sent a squadron to enforce their will and collect the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ debt.
We have no other option but to pay.

Haiti has, since its inception as a slave colony, had a troubled identity, being both essentially French, and indisputably African. The ideals of the French revolution drove the revolution that gained Haiti its own independence, but the memories of slavery drive many of our people to more closely identify with our Spanish speaking former slave neighbours. We stand at a crossroads, and are in a unique situation to choose which identity we want to pursue as a people.
Fate of our Nation
Yes, we are French!
Yes, we are African!

L'île de la Navasse is a small, practically uninhabited island located some 20 miles west of the Haitian mainland. While we have never settled it, our claims harken back to the Treaty of Ryswick in 1697, which specifically named this island as one of the territories transferred in addition to mainland Hispaniola. It has recently come to the interest of the great powers along with many islands in the Caribbean and Pacific because of its reserves of guano.
Navassa Island dispute
We must maintain our claim.
They will submit or suffer the consequences.

The dictator of Paraguay, Solano Lopez, has turned his eye towards Brazilian lands to the southeast. Direct access to the Atlantic Ocean would be of great benefit to the country, rather than relying on Uruguayan permission to use the river-- permission which might not always be forthcoming, thanks to Brazilian interference. Perhaps it is time to flex Paraguay's muscle and establish an empire of our own?
Solano's Ambition
Begin the war!
This would be terrible for Paraguay.
The noted journalist and leader of the Colorado Party, Jose Batlle y Ordonez achieved the passage of strong legislation for political reform in Uruguay.
FRENCH: Le fameux journaliste et chef du parti Colorado, Jose Batle y Ordonez, a fait voter en Uruguay une législation de poids sur les réformes politiques.
GERMAN: Jose Batlle y Ordonez, namhafter Journalist und Führer der Colorado-Partei, hat den Übergang Uruguays von einer starken Legislatur zu politischen Reformen realisiert.

ENGLISH: Jose Batlle y Ordonez
FRENCH: Jose Batle y Ordonez
GERMAN: Jose Batlle y Ordonez

ENGLISH: A time for reform has come.
FRENCH: L'heure des réformes a sonné.
GERMAN: Die Zeit für Reformen ist gekommen.

ENGLISH: Alberdi’s book, Bases for the Political Organization of the Argentine Republic , first published in 1852, the year of Rosas’ defeat, became the framework for the new Argentine constitution. The Argentine constitution that Alberdi crafted was modelled on that of the United States.
FRENCH: Le livre d'Alberdi, les bases de l'organisation politique de la République argentine, d'abord publié en 1852, année de la défaite de Rosas, est devenu le cadre de la nouvelle constitution argentine. La constitution argentine qu'Alberdi a conçu sur le modèle de celle des États-Unis.
GERMAN: Das im Jahr 1852, dem Jahr von Rosas Niederlage, veröffentlichte Buch 'Grundlagen für die politische Organisation der Republik Argentinien' wurde zum Rahmen der neuen argentinischen Verfassung. Alberdi hielt sich bei seinem Verfassungsentwurf an das Vorbild der amerikanischen Verfassung.

ENGLISH: Juan Bautista Alberdi
FRENCH: Juan Bautista Alberdi
GERMAN: Juan Bautista Alberdi

ENGLISH: His Ideas Have Merit
FRENCH: Ses idées ont du mérite
GERMAN: Seine Ideen sind sehr wertvoll!

ENGLISH: Suppress Alberdi’s Supporters!
FRENCH: Éliminez les partisans d'Alberdi !
GERMAN: Unterdrückt Alberdis Unterstützer!

ENGLISH: This book, first published in 1845, used the story of the dictator Facundo, to expose an opposition between European ‘civilization’ and native ‘barbarism’. As angry and condemning as Sarmiento was towards Facundo Quiroga, Rosas, and the people of the Pampas, there emerged in the book a wonderful, and at times admiring portrait of that part of Argentina that Sarmiento believed had to be killed off.
FRENCH: Ce livre, publié pour la première fois en 1845, utilise l'histoire du dictateur Facundo, afin d'exprimer une opposition entre la «civilisation» européenne et la «barbarie» indigène. En colère et condamnant que Sarmiento a été vers Facundo Quiroga, Rosas, et les gens des Pampas, cela a émergé dans le livre, un merveilleux et avec parfois admirable portrait de cette partie de l'Argentine que Sarmiento croyait disparu.
GERMAN: Dies zuerst 1845 veröffentlichte Buch stellt die europäische 'Zivilisation' anhand der Geschichte des Diktators Facundo gegen die 'Barbarei' der Eingeborenen. So wütend Sarmiento auch auf Facundo Quiroga, Rosas und das Volk der Pampa war—in diesem Buch entsteht doch zeitweise ein wunderbares wie gelegentlich bewunderndes Portrait dieses Teils Argentiniens, der nach der Meinung Sarmientos ausgerottet werden sollte.

ENGLISH: Facundo: or, Civilization and Barbarism
FRENCH: Facundo : ou la civilisation et la barbarie
GERMAN: Facundo bzw. 'Zivilisation' und 'Barbarei'

ENGLISH: Dangerous Ideas Afloat!
FRENCH: De dangereuses idées circulent !
GERMAN: Gefährliche Ideen im Anmarsch!

ENGLISH: Unrest is stirring against the Rosas dictatorship in Argentina, with liberals demanding a constitution and a transition to democratic rule. Justo José de Urquiza, the governor of Entre Rios, has approached the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government and asked us to support an uprising should Rosas refuse the liberal demands. The help we would give would be to install a democratic government in Argentina, not to support a free Entre-Rios.
The Argentine Confederation
We will support the uprising when it comes.
We cannot offer aid.

It is the will of the entrerriano people to resume the exercise of the powers inherent in its territorial sovereignty and currently delegated to His Excellency the Governor and Captain General of Buenos Aires, for the cultivation of external relations and general direction of peace and war of the Argentine Confederation, under the quadrilateral treaty of the coastal provinces dated January 4, 1831. Until now, the governor of Buenos Aires, Juan Manuel de Rosas, had all the government power and exercised all external relations for the Confederation. Each year he presented his resignation, knowing it would be rejected. Urquiza’s statement was the effective acceptance of the resignation of Rosas by the Province of Entre Rios, who was resuming its ability to conduct its trade and external relations with other nations until such constitution of a republic was formalized. Neighbouring governments might support Urquiza, and should he rise up in rebellion, they will intervene on his behalf.
The Constitutional Demand
We welcome the republic.
Deny and warn them that this is rebellion.
We fight with Buenos Aires!

With Rosas unable to defeat the Entre Rios rebellion, General Urquiza has assumed temporary control of the government. Meeting with liberals in Santa Fe, they have drawn up a new constitution to the Argentine Constitution. The province of Buenos Aires is displeased and vows to resist while the former Governor and President, Juan Manuel de Rosas, was forced to flee the country and is now exiled in the United Kingdom. Bartolome Mitre assumed Buenos Aires in his stead.
The Argentine Constitution of $YEAR$
Long live the Republic!

The rebellion in the provinces of the Argentine confederation have been put down, and both General Urquiza and his supporters have been captured and executed. The Argentine provinces have submitted to the will of Buenos Aires, and Rosas reigns supreme, the sole judge on the fate of Argentina.
Rosas is Victorious!
Unite Argentina!
Let’s continue as a Federation.

In $YEAR$ the old struggle between conservative and liberal factions broke out once more in Uruguay when the Colorado leader Venancio Flores rose against President Bernardo Berro of the Blanco party. Since Paraguayan dictator Solano López had always supported the Blancos he declared any interference in Uruguay to be unacceptable. Supporting the Colorados would give us a chance to finally end the López regime and take our claims if he decides to intervene.
The Triple Alliance
We will support the Colorados.
We cannot offer aid.

We have won the war against all odds! The Triple Alliance has been defeated and agreed to negotiate peace without conditions. The question is now, how harsh should our conditions be? Securing our sea access should be enough to minimize future conflicts, however this is our best chance to become a regional power - but for how long?
The Triple Alliance Defeated
Secure our sea access - impose mild conditions.
Become a regional power - impose harsh conditions.

Solano López is dead and Paraguay lays in ruins - the war is over. As Paraguay isn't a threat anymore, we can just take our claims and keep the country a buffer state. However some of our politicians argue that Paraguay is a non-country and it should be partitioned between Argentina and Brazil.
The Triple Alliance Victorious
Take our claims and keep Paraguay a buffer state.
Paraguay has no right to exist - partition the country.

The consequences of defeat were disastrous for Paraguay. Argentina and Brazil annexed about 54,000 square miles of Paraguayan territory – almost half the country. Initially the Argentine negotiators proposed to simply divide Paraguay between Argentina and Brazil, but the Brazilians refused, preferring to maintain a buffer state between themselves and their old rival.
We have no choice but to accept.

At the end of the war, with Paraguay suffering severe shortages of weapons and supplies, Solano López reacted with draconian attempts to keep order, ordering troops to kill any of their colleagues, including officers, who talked of surrender. Paranoia prevailed in the army, and soldiers fought to the bitter end in a resistance movement, resulting in more destruction in the country. Meanwhile the Triple Alliance has decided to divide Paraguay between Argentina and Brazil.
It's over, Solano.

With Paraguay becoming a relevant power in the region, many wonder what will be the next move of Solano López. Most likely he will crown himself emperor as he ordered an exact replica of Napoleon's crown for himself. Some believe he will keep his dictatorial powers, but a vocal minority speculates that he will - with a move as unexpected as the war - transition the country to democracy.
The Future of Paraguay
Long live Emperor Francisco Solano López I!
Paraguay remains a dictatorship!
Give the power back to the people.

Our $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ allies have opted to partition Paraguay between its neighbours and are asking us to reconsider the choice we have made to respect Paraguayan sovereignty, claiming our support would go a long way in making the partition a reality. While we would stand to gain from this partition, one stands to wonder how the lack of a buffer state would affect the balance of power and diplomacy in the region.
Reconsidering the partition
We will not impede on Paraguayan sovereignty
On second thought...

The foreign minister of $FROMCOUNTRY$ is on a special mission to delineate a treaty to settle a border issue between our nations. The treaty would essentially create a border between both nations along the Putumayo River.
The Salomón–Lozano Treaty
Sign the treaty.
Never, it's our land!

Following their defeat in the so-called 'War of the Triple Alliance', Paraguay has been the subject of much deliberation, and our ambassadors and diplomats in South America write to us that it is in all likelyhood that Paraguay will cease to exist as a state, annexed by their larger neighbours. This would, among other things, diminish our influence in the region, and create tensions between these former allies, who would now share significantly larger borders. Our ambassador in Buenos Aires has the ear of the Argentine president, and feels like he may be able to convince him that Paraguay is worth much more to Argentina as a buffer state. This may, however, be seen as undue influence in another nation's foreign policy.
Paraguayan independence at risk
Let's try to talk the Argentinians down
Leave Paraguay to its fate

This morning, just as the partition of Paraguay was being discussed, the ambassador of the United States of America has asked for an audience with the president. After much discussion for most of the morning and over lunch, the ambassador has laid out that he believes the partition of Paraguay will diplomatically destabilize the region. We already have overlapping claims with Bolivia in the Gran Chaco, and would now also have a much longer border with them and Brazil. Keeping Paraguay as a sovereign state, even a rump, barely-independent one, he argues, would provide a much needed buffer where tensions would have time to cool down.
The American Ambassador
The ambassador is right, withdraw support for partition
We will go ahead with the partition anyway
He would have us withdraw our troops so that America can keep her influence. Ha!

Believed to be an estate built for the Inca emperor Pachacuti, Machu Picchu was built around 1450 but it was abandoned a century later at the time of the Spanish Conquest. Although known locally, it was not known to the Spanish during the colonial period and remained unknown to the outside world until a $COUNTRY_ADJ$ historian brought it to international attention in $YEAR$. Machu Picchu was built in the classical Inca style, with polished dry-stone walls. Its three primary structures are the Inti Watana, the Temple of the Sun, and the Room of the Three Windows. $COUNTRY_ADJ$ researchers believe this to be the fabled ‘Lost City of the Incas’, the last Inca capital, founded by Manco Inca but lost to the ages, the fire and the steel of the Spanish conquest.
The Lost City of the Incas
At last the mystery is solved.
Agricultural fertilizers processed from guano is now in great demand in Europe and North America. The deposits of guano on our offshore islands could become a major benefit to our nation.
FRENCH: Les engrais agricoles à base de guano sont désormais très demandés en Europe et en Amérique du nord. Les dépôts de guano sur nos îles du large pourraient devenir une source de profit importante pour notre pays.
GERMAN: Landwirtschaftlicher Dünger aus Guano wird in Europa und Nordamerika jetzt stark nachgefragt. Die Guano-Ablagerungen auf den Inseln vor unserer Küste könnte schon für unsere Nation schon bald zu einem großen Vorteil werden.

ENGLISH: Wealth From Guano
FRENCH: La richesse du guano
GERMAN: Reichtum durch Guano

ENGLISH: Ah the fragrant smell of success.
FRENCH: Ah, le parfum du succès !
GERMAN: Ah, der … kernige Duft des Erfolgs.

ENGLISH: Our duke was the nearest relative in the succession of the Duchy of Anhalt-Köthen in 1847, and became the successor to Alexander Karl, Duke of Anhalt-Bernburg, who did not have a direct heir. Anhalt was at last united under one duke.
FRENCH: Notre duc était le successeur légitime du duc d'Anhalt-Köthen en 1847, et maintenant il succède à Alexander Karl, duc d'Anhalt-Bernburg, qui n'avait pas d'héritier direct. L'Anhalt est enfin unifié sous l'autorité d'un seul duc !
GERMAN: Unser Herzog war in der Erbfolge des Herzogtums Anhalt-Köthen 1847 der Nächste und folgt nun Alexander Karl, Herzog von Anhalt-Bernburg auf den Thron, da dieser keinen direkten Erben hatte. Endlich ist Anhalt unter einem einzigen Herzog vereinigt!

ENGLISH: Leopold IV of Anhalt-Dessau is Duke of All Anhalt!
FRENCH: Léopold IV d'Anhalt-Dessau est duc de tout l'Anhalt !
GERMAN: Leopold IV. von Anhalt-Dessau ist nun Herzog ganz Anhalts!

ENGLISH: Long Live The Duke!
FRENCH: Vive le duc !
GERMAN: Lang lebe der Herzog!

ENGLISH: Members of the $FROMCOUNTRY$ government have approached us, suggesting that the Kalmar Union must be resurrected. For the moment, this is simply an idea, a suggestion that the Scandinavian nations should work together towards an eventual union. If we disagree, it’s possible that the idea dies here. If we don’t, $FROMCOUNTRY$ might be mortally insulted. If Scandinavians are to take their rightful place in Europe, however, perhaps there is merit in their proposal.
Reforming the Kalmar Union
A royal marriage cannot hurt, I suppose.
We see little reason to join such a union.
$FROMCOUNTRY$ has refused the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ proposal. It is now in our hands whether to let the Union die here and now, or force $FROMCOUNTRY$ to join us whether they like it or not.
$FROMCOUNTRY$ Has Refused!
Oh well, I guess that’s over then.
We’ll see how they feel with an army in their capital…

$FROMCOUNTRY$ has proposed the next logical step in our mutual cooperation: a customs union between $COUNTRY$ and $FROMCOUNTRY$, indeed all of Scandinavia, which would remove the restrictions on trade between us.
Form a Customs Union?
A customs union cannot hurt, I suppose.
This is going too far.
$FROMCOUNTRY$ has suggested a political union between their country and $COUNTRY$, arguing that this is the next logical step for Scandinavia’s security.
Form a Political Union?
It seems like a logical argument.
This is going too far.
Your Norwegian subjects seek to establish their own independent kingdom. The other European powers support their independence, and will be upset if we refuse.
Norway Asks For Independence
We support their right to self-determination.
We will not grant this request. Our people share a common history and future.
This time they are not asking nicely. Independence or war.
Norway Demands Independence
We will let them go.
This will be a splendid little war.
Your Finnish subjects seek to form their own nation.
Finnish Independence
We will be better off without them.
Finland is an integral part of our empire.
Your Danish subjects wish to end our union.
Danish Independence
They have a right to form their own kingdom.
How dare they challenge our authority!
As our power in Scandinavia wanes and $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ influence grows, so does the focus of the union move to them.
The Leadership of Kalmar
Well, shucks.

Our subjects in Finland have become restless and resistance against attempts of Russification have been growing. Many within the Russian government believe that a restoration of the Diet of Finland and limited self-government for their nation is the only answer. This, however, will be seen as a recognition of Finland as a country and will block any future attempts to try to Russify Finland through peaceful means.
The Grand Duchy of Finland
Reopen the Diet of Finland.

The islands of Orkney and Shetland were pawned to the Scottish kings in the 15th century by king Christian I of Denmark to pay the dowry when his daugher Margaret became engaged to James III of Scotland. Since then, embassies were made to return the islands and pay off the debt many times, and each time, the Scots, rather than disprove the Danish claims, just ignored them, knowing the Danes would not go to war. Then, the kingdom of Scotland was joined with the kingdom of England in 1707. and the issue was abandoned. After so many years, we had managed to retake these isles and truly reassert our claims.
A debt finally repaid
$COUNTRY$ shall once more rule the North Sea

Several years ago, a European expedition accompanied by black guides and workers entered the lands of Mwembe with a purpose that is not fully understood, theoretically in direction of Lake Niassa. Somewhere along the Yao territory the expedition was ambushed, the Europeans were killed and the Africans enslaved. It is said among the Wayao that Ce Bwonomali devoured the head of the commanding officer after he sprinkled it with piri-piri pepper and declared that it was ‘fish.’ It is also said he kept the skull which now served to make libations, passing this legacy to his successor, and that hence forth, all the Mataka used for the same purpose. \n Our military leaders proposed a payback in the form of a military expedition against these barbarians so we can bring this uncivilised territory under our control.
The Sultanate of Mataka
This can’t stand.
Maybe we shouldn’t mess with them.

The Mozambique Company was a Portuguese company established in $YEAR$ with a capital stock of about 5 million dollars obtained from financiers from Germany, the United Kingdom and South Africa. Isaacman and Isaacman report that the firm was capitalized at 40,000 pounds, and that British and French capital quickly predominated. The company got a concession to explore the area of Mossurize for a period of 50 years. Around the same time, Portuguese landholder and imperialist Joaquim Carlos Paiva de Andrada established a base at a river mouth in the Sofala province, bringing the old and unmanned forts in the coast of Sofala back to use and cementing Portuguese control in the region.
The Mozambique Company
Great news!

On the northern bank of Espírito Santo Estuary of Delagoa Bay, an inlet of the Indian Ocean, Lourenço Marques was named after the Portuguese navigator. The forts and trading stations that the Portuguese established, abandoned and reoccupied on the north bank of the river, were all called Lourenço Marques. Our previous settlement in the area was entirely destroyed by the natives, and now it’s the time to get it back. Our advisors tell us that sending a military expedition to secure the town should be enough for now. They also report come that the city of Inhambane, destroyed by Soshangane in 1834, was rebuilt and prosper, allowing us to exert control over its surrounding territories once again.
Lourenço Marques
Lourenço Marques was once ours, and it shall be again!

The death of Soshangane, the chief of Gaza, made his fragile chiefdom descend in a spiral of chaos as his sons, Mzila and Mawewe, fight for the throne. Soshangane’s armies, that once overran the Portuguese settlements at Delagoa Bay, Inhambane and Sena, now turn their gaze inwards as the chiefdom slowly edges towards civil war. It goes without saying that this represents an optimal opportunity to take some of these lands back, and several individuals in the colonies already began to take advantage of this situation.
The Death of Soshangane
Let us extend the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Empire.

With the colonial powers of Europe having met at the Congo Conference to decide the orderly division of the African continent, pressure for $FROMCOUNTRY$ to occupy the lands they laid claims to build up. Their diplomats have been in close contact with the princes of Cabinda and with additional urging they were able to conclude a treaty forcing the Kongolese to surrender it over their Angolan claims. Under the Conference’s principle of effective occupation, the land they took is theirs by right. They did violate our sphere by negotiating directly with the Congo though, so that could be used as a justification to retaliate.
The Treaty of Simulambuko
It’s not a big deal anyway.
We will make sure they won’t be able to violate our sphere again.
